title.rendered: Emerging Fashion Trends: The Pandemic Edition

content.rendered:
Fashion is an industry that runs on change – with new trends, styles, and ranges being offered every season. The health crisis we’re facing now is expected to lead to changes in fashion – just like the 1918 flu pandemic, the Great Depression and the Second World War caused massive social, financial, and fashion upheaval.

Today’s fashion must-haves have been redefined by the wearers themselves due to the consequences of the COVID-19 pandemic, rather than by fashion designers. Many people are working from home in pyjamas and sweatpants, with shoes and makeup becoming a thing of the past. And now, before you leave the house, you have to check for your wallet, keys …and your face mask, which is all part of the ‘new normal’.

At a time when it’s more important than ever to remain indoors and work from home wherever possible. It’s also imperative to create joy wherever and however you can.

Look out for these trends and go-to pieces and don’t let the pandemic dull your sparkle!

1. Shop local

It’s no secret that the fashion industry is trying to reinvent itself as something more sustainable. This presents a big opportunity for local brands, as there has been a significant rise in demand for local products, with consumers more aware of the issues with the fast fashion industry and the damage it has had on the environment.

The rise of local brands and the decline of fast fashion trends indicates that a focus on sustainable lifestyles will also be part of upcoming fashion trends. So checking out sustainable and planet-friendly brands, both online and within your community, or trying out a new online thrift store is a good start to not only find some very unique pieces but also contribute towards the growth.

2. Masks…but make it a fashion trend!

DIY and designer masks of different materials, filled with quirky patterns, floral embroidery, prints, and colors are the latest addition to fashion accessories.

3. Don’t forget the feet!

In this quarantine season where comfort comes first, sliders, crocs, and flip-flops have taken center stage and are now the footwear of choice for fashionistas everywhere. Suitable when you’re stuck indoors, and stylish for when you want to step outside.

4. Cocooning comes first

Why bother with jeans or suit pants while working from home? Leggings are in, and due to quarantine, they are predicted to stay around the the next summer season. Consumers are looking for clothes that are practical and high quality, in soft, comfortable materials.

The popularity of track pants is rising, and they appear to be the biggest fashion trend at the moment.

Other classic comfort pieces are trending, as well. Sweat-shorts, for example, are a new trend we’re seeing everywhere, and lounge pieces are most popular in neutral colors, such as greys and soft pastels.

Today’s cocooning trend also includes puffer vests to wear indoors, alongside track pants, sweat-shorts and hoodies.

Looking sharp and stylish, but feeling comfy? That’s something we’re on board with.

Related: Look Out For These Black Friday Shopping Hacks: The Pandemic Edition

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find new fashion trends during the pandemic? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!
